item.title: Hollow Knight: Silksong Release Date Revealed
item.content:encoded:
The long-awaited release date for Hollow Knight: Silksong has finally been announced as part of Gamescom 2025.

First announced in February 2019, our Andy Highton had a hands-on preview at Gamescom and was left very impressed by the results, while fans online are desperate to play the same demo as they eagerly await the end of the long, hard wait for a release date for Hollow Knight: Silksong.

The end date for that wait has finally been revealed, however, with a short special announcement trailer from Team Cherry.

Hollow Knight: Silksong Releases September 4

In a special announcement video that premiered on YouTube, developer Team Cherry showed off new gameplay from the anticipated sequel along with the release date.

It was an agonisingly long wait for such a short video, with a three-minute countdown followed by some gameplay. The big reveal came right at the end, with Hollow Knight: Silksong confirmed for a September 4 launch.

You can watch the full video of the special announcement below.

Hollow Knight: Silksong will be available on PC, Xbox Series X|S, PlayStation 5, PlayStation 4, Xbox One, and Nintendo Switch 1 & 2. It will also be available via Xbox Game Pass.

Will Hollow Knight: Silksong be a Game of the Year contender after it launches on September 4? Let us know your predictions down below, and join the discussion in the Insider Gaming forum.

For more news, check out the release date of Stalker 2 on PlayStation 5, and take a look at a leak hinting at the setting for Forza Horizon 6.  And be sure to sign up for our weekly newsletter.

SUBSCRIBE to our newsletter to receive the latest news and exclusive leaks every week! No Spam.

item.title: Intel Giving Away Battlefield 6 With CPU or GPU Purchase
item.content:encoded:
Intel wants to give you a copy of Battlefield 6. Of course, that’s if you decide to buy a new Intel CPU or Graphics Card (GPU) first.

Starting on August 25, and running through September 7, players just have to buy one of dozens of available products in order to get a copy of Battlefield 6 completely free. The bundle will be available, Intel says, at over 200 retail partners.

When a qualifying product is purchased, you’ll be able to redeem your key for the game between August 25 and October 31. A list of all eligible products can be found below.

And be sure to let us know in the comments if you plan on upgrading your PC with a new Intel CPU or GPU in order to save $70 and get Battlefield 6 for free.

Intel & Battlefield 6 Eligible Products

Intel Core 13th Gen Mobile

  • Intel Core i5-13420H
  • Intel Core i5-13500H
  • Intel Core i5-13600H
  • Intel Core i7-13620H

item.title: Elden Ring Struggles On Nintendo Switch 2 Handheld Mode
item.content:encoded:
Elden Ring is coming to Nintendo Switch 2, and it reportedly struggles to run on the latest Nintendo console?

According to Nintendo Life’s Felix Sanchez, who spent time with the game while in Cologne for Gamescom the game has serious performance issues on the Switch 2 when playing in handheld mode.

“Performance wise, here at that big first fight, as soon as you step outside, the framerate drops quite substantially,” Sanchez said while mentioning that it’s always locked at 30 frames per second

He then continued: “You get to the outside world, and the framerate just tanks. It’s really bad, and I understand why they don’t want you to see this.

More Gamescom: Future Games Show at Gamescom 2025: Everything Announced

“It is terrible. Of course, you’re never going to see the light of this because—well, maybe it’ll release in that state, but I can’t imagine it will.”

Sanchez said it felt like 20 frames per second and, sometimes, as low as 15. It would happen, he said, doing the “most simple stuff”.

As far as the positives, Sanchez did say that while it doesn’t look as good as PC or PlayStation—as should be expected—it did look “really good”. He also said the tutorial area of the game performed properly.

Elden Ring Tarnished Edition is scheduled to release on Nintendo Switch 2 later this year. A firm release date, however, has yet to be announced.

Are you nervous about Elden Ring’s performance on the Switch 2? Let us know down below, and take the discussion even further in the official Insider Gaming forums.

For even more Gamescom coverage from Insider Gaming, check out Andy Highton’s preview of Hollow Knight: Silksong and Tom Henderson’s preview of World of Tanks: HEAT.

item.title: Once Human’s Next Big Update is Coming Next Week
item.content:encoded:
Once Human’s next big update lands next week, it was announced at Gamescom, as the title continues to grow with more features and experiences.

First released in July 2024, Once Human has grown in the year since, including the launch of a PvP spin-off, RaidZone. Now, the base game itself is getting a big update.

Stellar Resonance is a new gameplay mode that lands in Once Human next week, introducing Gravity Integrators and a host of rewards.

Once Human Stellar Resonance Releases August 28

In a press release sent to Insider Gaming, the Stellar Resonance update is said to “drastically change” gameplay and offer “all-new challenges” for players.

Further details were shared on the official website, with the event period beginning August 28 and running to September 25. After the update is live, players will receive a Gravity Integrator blueprint when a Star Advent Loot Crate is opened for the first time, which can be used at an Intermediate or Advanced Supplies Workbench.

Once placed and activated, the Gravity Integrator will begin to ascend, constantly accumulating Stellar Core Gravity Samples and unlocking tiered rewards the higher it ascends. However, it will also attract Deviants and must be defended.

Global Research is also available in the update, with progress shared across all servers for the same region, unlocking new bonuses and additional reward claim chances. However, the mission is “extremely urgent”, and, if a new research phase is not within five days, bonuses will be lost and attacking Deviants will be stronger.

Additional optimizations were also deployed, including increased gliding and descending speed, improved airbone mechanics, and the ability to cancel aiming when performing a plunging melee attack.

Are far have you gotten in Once Human? Are you excited for the update? Let us know in the Insider Gaming forum.

For more news, check out the reveal of the Stalker 2 PlayStation 5 release date, and read about PowerWash Simulator 2 confirmed for Xbox Game Pass.

SUBSCRIBE to our newsletter to receive the latest news and exclusive leaks every week! No Spam.
